name: Hampton Inn San Francisco-Airport

reviews.text: Everything was wonderful: a big and very clean room,very good breakfast,good location(a few minutes from airport and convenient approach to S.F),and a very helpfully and so friendly staff.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and very friendly staff

reviews.text: We definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Worth staying

reviews.text: Aside from the loud and at times scary noise of the flushing toilet, everything else was good. The bed was very comfortable, the complimentary breakfast was healthy and the staff was friendly. The location was a bit far from the airport though and there was no restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Good Value for San Francisco area

reviews.text: I hadn't planned on staying in the San Francisco area but a misdirected suitcase forced us to pick a place reasonable close to SFO. This hotel was reasonably priced, especially compared to SF in general, close to SFO and close enough to the city. The room was very comfortable and the staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Airport Hotel
Great service; free parking in San Francisco
reviews.text: A good hotel, especially with regards to their shuttle service (free). It was very convenient to ride the train into San Francisco, return to the airport via the train and catch the shuttle bus back to the hotel which runs every 15 minutes. The front desk staff were just great and very personable with us. We did appreciate the food offered for breakfast as it was quick and light. There is a nice area for seating to eat or to just read the newspaper. The room was a little larger than the typical offerings at other Hampton Inns around the country. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone flying in or out of San Francisco as a jumping off point for other cities you may be travelling to. I have seen a few of the other reviews of the hotel with regard to needing renovation, in my case however, the room was very clean, the entry was exceptional. Having been here before, I even asked if I could be next to the elevator in this hotel-I know, who does that? But you cannot hear the elevator at all as it moves and having doors opening with sound etc. The sound-proofing is the best, so don't be afraid to ask for a room next to them if you would like to have really easy access to in and out of the place. You will never know you are next to one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice, clean hotel with friendly staff. The location near the CalTrain and Airport is very handy.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is very nice and safe. The rooms were very nice and not expensive. San Fransisco has a great transportation system, and there is no need to stay downtown where parking is an issue.
reviews.title: Loved our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: a quailty motel

reviews.text: We love this hotel. It has a great location for catching the CalTrain to the Giants games. The rooms are neat and clean and I appreciate that they wash the bedspreads after each guest. The breakfast is wonderful with lots of variety and good quality. We look forward to our stay here whenever we are in San Francisco.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service and in Need of Renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was of great quality. The staff was helpful and friendly. Gave us information on different sites in the city and even made phone calls to set up tours for us. Breakfast was complete with different items for each day. Very good place to stay and would highly recommend.
reviews.title: comfortable place for hanging out

reviews.text: We stayed here from a Friday through Sunday. The photos on the hotel's web page don't really do it justice. It looks a lot better in person and is in a quiet office park just off the freeway. The double room we had was clean and well appointed, although the room had a very faint smell of smoke (we opened the window and that took care of that). The full breakfast was included and the staff were great at making sure the food was fresh and stayed stocked for the constant stream of guests. If you don't mind staying outside SF and are looking for an affordable, clean, well appointed hotel, I recommend this Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Really Good Stay (Nice and Quiet)

reviews.text: As with all Hamptons this hotel provides basic accomodation with breakfast.. The hotel/rooms were clean and the staff freindly. Not the place for a long stay but if passing through it ticks the boxes. We were staying for a couple of nights and would not want to stay longer. It is some distance away from the attractions and a car is essential. We stayed in a number of Hamptons on our road trip and the breakfast in this one was the worst . I don't suppose it helped that we had torrential rain and it was really cold when we visited.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.text: We checked out 4 rooms for my bro's bachelor party as a sleeping spot. The hotel was nice, rooms clean, nothing fancy but all 4 rooms were equally in good shape. I like that there is no smoking in the hotel and that there are multiple exits/entrances depending on where you park so you don't have to take the elevator or always walk through the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Safe if not boring location

reviews.text: The location is really in/near a business park. Not a whole lot around. There is the Embassy Suites next door which has restaurant and a Wendy's and Starbucks with in walking distance. Other than that plan on driving to eat or taking the shuttle to Pier 39.
reviews.title: Good Overnight Convenient Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reason I didn't stay at Embassy is that they charge $17/car to park and this joint is free. Now that I know how close these places are (share a parking lot) I'll stay at Embassy and park at Hampton!!!
reviews.title: sleezy

reviews.text: We stayed four nights in August to attend a friend's bat mitzvah on the Peninsula. We found the hotel to be clean and conveniently located. There are many cafes and shops nearby in South San Francisco. It is very convenient to the 101 Freeway.
reviews.title: Convenient and Clean

reviews.text: The room decor is horrible, but aside from that the room was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. The staff was a bit hyper vigilant about details, I experienced some things prior to checking in that I had not previously experienced at any of my multiple Hampton Inn stays.
reviews.title: Overall Good Experience

reviews.text: We do not partake in the free breakfast as that is not the quality of food we like.
reviews.title: It's a Hampton Inn- higher your expectations

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who has business in the SF area and needs a conveniently located place to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful time with Hampton

reviews.text: Mahalo
reviews.title: Cozy and good access to SFO

reviews.text: I came in on a late flight and they took care of everything for me at a good price. Everything was clean and comfortable and they were very helpful when I wanted a midnite snack.
reviews.title: Quick and Easy to get a room late

reviews.text: 2nd time to stay here. Strongly recommend it. Will definitely go back!
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: Hampton Inns are usually the first properties we look at when booking accommodations. They rarely disappoint in comfort and cleanliness and also a great bargain! This place remains true to those standards. Our room was roomy, comfortable for the four of us. The layout of the room is a bit peculiar...bathroom sink located outside of bathroom in essentially the hall. The in-room fridge and microwave are behind the front door, kinda hard to get to. They have an excellent 'hot' breakfast. The staff is helpful and friendly. Location is convenient - shuttle to airport and to downtown SF. No serious complaints...definitely would stay here again!
reviews.title: Consistently Good

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and located very close to the airport. Very reasonably priced and a comfortable hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Good solid Hampton Inn. Clean, reliable shuttle service. I have stayed here multiple times and always a very good experience. My only complaint is that it can be hard to get into as it is one of the most cost effective options in the area. Staff is very pleasant and it is in a great location.
reviews.title: Good place to stay at SFO

reviews.text: We stayed there for 1 night until we go to SF downtown hotel. The location is hidden behind another hotel.
reviews.title: A decent overnight hotel

reviews.text: The room is just ok, the kind of room where I don't feel comfortable walking around barefoot in. It has a microwave and a minifridge.
reviews.title: Review, of course....

reviews.text: Breakfast was decent with a waffle maker and some other hot food items (egg, meat, potato) and of course the usual continental items such as pastries and such.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient stay near SFO

reviews.text: I don't see any huge faults with this hotel, but I don't see any pluses either.
reviews.title: Quite comfy and priced right

reviews.text: Overall we got what we paid for.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We were supposed to be booked w/ Embassy Suites but they oversold their rooms, so we were sent to the Hampton Inn instead. Embassy paid for the night but it was not worth it. Nothing on the Hampton, but we could not unpack knowing we were moving to another hotel the next morning and we checked in at 9pm. We didn't really experience any service or luxuries about the hotel, just a get in, get out experience. We hustled our best to make check out and get the buffet breakfast in time at Embassy but nobody over there told us the weekday breakfast closed down at 9am and not at 10:30am like the weekends. Embassy also promised us the same, 1 king suite as they have but the Hampton has no such thing. I got a free dinner for my family in return, besides the first night for free. Still not sure that any of it was really worth the trouble.
reviews.title: Average for a last minute comp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had everything we needed. Stayed here last night of wine country vacation so we would be close to airport. Breakfast had greater variety and many hot foods unlike most continental breakfasts. Desk staff greeted us and asked if there was anything we needed every time we walked by.
reviews.title: Quality and convenience

reviews.text: Great Free Break fast both Veg and Non- Veg, Lot of time the restaurant is open. Nice rooms, Clean toilets. Good cosmetics supplied in bath rooms. Well maintained. Friendly staff. Centrally located near Cal-trains Station and Air Port. Calm area with no noise. Ample Car parking
reviews.title: Nice
Hotel Stay
reviews.text: Nice hotel conveniently located just south of San Francisco. Have stayed here previously and find it ideally located and a great value for its proximity to the city. Will stay there again and always recommend it to friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient to the airport. Staff was helpful and courterous. Wonderfully comfortable beds and a great breakfast. It is easy to get on and off the freeway. You can depend on clean and comfortable rooms. While our stay was short we would definitely recommend a stay here.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Comfortable room with microwave, and a refrigerator to keep our special need food.
reviews.title: everything we needed

reviews.text: The breakfast served was varied and even had skim milk which is not usually available at hotels and motels.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hotel In A Great Location

reviews.text: We left our book at home and there was an interesting selection of books in the lobby to borrow.
reviews.title: Great Hideaway Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was very nice and clean. It's located in a rather quiet area minutes to the airport. The beds and pillows were pretty comfortable and the room was fairly spacious. I have teenage kids and we rented a couple of DVD's from Redbox and to find there was no DVD player included in the hotel or to rent out for a night was disappointing. The hotel had a full breakfast which was quite good. Overall, we enjoyed our night's stay here at Hampton Inn South San Francisco. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: In san Francisco on business and spent 3 days at this property......Great service and great staff!! Rooms were spacious, comfortable and very well equipped with all of the comforts of home to include a refrigerator and microwave. Close to area restaurants and only minutes from the "city"....well priced and a great stay! Thank you!!
reviews.title: Free room upgrade

aka: Hampton Inn San Francisco Airport Hotel
description: Located just 1.5 miles from the San Francisco International Airport, our hotels offers an ideal location for both business and leisure travelers. Situated in the center of the biotech industry and minutes away from downtown San Francisco, our guests enjoy the best of the bay area. We offer free shuttle to/from the San Francisco International Airport, as well as a free shuttle to Union Square (shopping center in downtown San Francisco), Fri-Sat. We also offer multiple types of rooms including suites and meeting rooms. Free WiFi, free daily hot breakfast, free parking, fitness center, Manager's Reception (M-W). Also, each room has a 37in LCD flat screen TV with numerous HD channels. We Love Having you Here!
